name: eager-pathogen-screening
title: EAGER: Ancient Pathogen Screening
description: Screen ancient DNA samples for pathogenic organisms (bacteria, viruses). Identifies historical pathogens like plague, tuberculosis, and smallpox from archaeological remains with damage-aware mapping.
content:
EAGER: Ancient Pathogen Screening

Screen ancient DNA for historical pathogens. Identifies bacterial and viral DNA from archaeological samples to study disease history, epidemics, and pathogen evolution.

Applications

  • Black Death: Yersinia pestis from medieval plague victims
  • Tuberculosis: Mycobacterium tuberculosis evolution
  • Smallpox: Historical Variola virus
  • Leprosy: Mycobacterium leprae
  • Syphilis: Treponema pallidum origin

Key Features

  • Metagenomic Screening: MALT, Kraken2 for pathogen ID
  • Damage Patterns: Authenticate ancient pathogen DNA
  • Low Coverage: Detect pathogens at <0.1X coverage
  • Reference Mapping: Map to pathogen genomes

Perfect for: Ancient pathogens • Disease history • Pathogen evolution • Archaeological screening
